tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE water_quality_measurements (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(50),
    measurement_date DATE,
    pH FLOAT,
    salinity FLOAT,
    turbidity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE water_quality_measurements (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    measurement_date DATE,
    pH FLOAT,
    salinity FLOAT,
    temperature FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE water_quality_measurements (
    measurement_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    measurement_date DATE,
    ph_level DECIMAL(5, 2),
    salinity DECIMAL(6, 2),
    temperature DECIMAL(5, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE measurements_sources (
    source_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_name VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    contact_person VARCHAR(100),
    contact_email VARCHAR(100),
    location_id INT REFERENCES marine_locations(location_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterQualityMeasurement (
    measurement_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_id INT,
    measurement_date DATE,
    pH FLOAT,
    temperature FLOAT,
    salinity FLOAT,
    PRIMARY KEY (measurement_id, location_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES Location(location_id)
);

CREATE TABLE OrganismObservation (
    observation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    organism_id INT,
    measurement_id INT,
    quantity INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (observation_id, organism_id, measurement_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (organism_id) REFERENCES MarineOrganisms(organism_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (measurement_id) REFERENCES WaterQualityMeasurement(measurement_id)
);
CREATE TABLE water_quality_measurements ( location_id INT, date DATE, salinity FLOAT, pH FLOAT, temperature FLOAT )
CREATE TABLE locations ( location_id INT, location_name VARCHAR(50), country VARCHAR(50) )
CREATE TABLE measurements_sources ( source_id INT, source_name VARCHAR(50) )
CREATE TABLE parameters ( parameter_id INT, parameter_name VARCHAR(50), unit VARCHAR(10) )
CREATE TABLE measurements ( location_id INT, parameter_id INT, value FLOAT, measurement_date DATE )
